properties.entry: Concatenates two tables. The top of the output table is given as the first input table (top input port), the bottom as the second table, resp. If both tables contain the same column names, they are concatenated (the column type is the common base type of both input column types). If one input table contains a column name that the other table doesn't, this column will be in output table as well but it will contain missing values for those row that are given by the table lacking this column. The dialog allows to treat duplicate row keys, two options are available:
Duplicate row keys in the bottom table are not in the output table.
The output table will contain all rows, but duplicate row keys are labeled with a suffix.
